# The `ConstantRange` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class represents a range of values. <a href="#details">More...</a>

</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This class represents a range of values.

### enum  {#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::ConstantRange::PreferredRangeType ">
If represented precisely, the result of some range operations may consist of multiple disjoint ranges.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a25a373cd66e09df5cb7b8cf3f443ea2b" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Smallest">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082ade1662f5186fd8852b4dcce8eb6563bc" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Unsigned">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a8260f3d302e2463fd93753dfd0de6ec1" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Signed">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

As only a single range may be returned, any range covering these disjoint ranges constitutes a valid result, but some may be more useful than others depending on context. The preferred range type specifies whether a range that is non-wrapping in the unsigned or signed domain, or has the smallest size, is preferred. If a signedness is preferred but all ranges are non-wrapping or all wrapping, then the smallest set size is preferred. If there are multiple smallest sets, any one of them may be returned.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h/#l00327">327</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h">ConstantRange.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<code>BitWidth</code> is the target bitwidth of the cast. For casts which don&#39;t change bitwidth, it must be the same as the source bitwidth. For casts which do change bitwidth, the bitwidth must be consistent with the requested cast and source bitwidth.

### getActiveBits() {#a059a0dff9799816117b8b2fd73bd1425}

<MemberDefinition

### unionWith() {#aa81521f99442a5c30f9061b8c6ce795e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantRange ConstantRange::unionWith (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp; CR, <a href="#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082">PreferredRangeType</a> Type=<a href="#a0e6f2069000829208cbac185a07d8082a25a373cd66e09df5cb7b8cf3f443ea2b">Smallest</a>) const</>}>
Return the range that results from the union of this range with another range.

The resultant range is guaranteed to include the elements of both sets, but may contain more. For example, &#91;3, 9) union &#91;12,15) is &#91;3, 15), which includes 9, 10, and 11, which were not included in either set before.

### makeAllowedICmpRegion() {#aa0830ec6778859b4abb3e8bf0b9e0e38}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantRange ConstantRange::makeAllowedICmpRegion (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">CmpInst::Predicate</a> Pred, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp; Other)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Produce the smallest range such that all values that may satisfy the given predicate with any value contained within Other is contained in the returned range.

Formally, this returns a superset of &#39;union over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;. If the exact answer is not representable as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a>, the return value will be a proper superset of the above.

Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 &#91;2, 5) returns Result = &#91;0, 4)

### makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion() {#ace208c0bd1d845fe49f319be6a954764}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantRange ConstantRange::makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#ac26154a24f393f523c87cc5f8239f36c">Instruction::BinaryOps</a> BinOp, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp; Other, unsigned NoWrapKind)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Produce the largest range containing all X such that &quot;X BinOp Y&quot; is guaranteed not to wrap (overflow) for <em>all</em> Y in Other.

However, there may be <em>some</em> Y in Other for which additional X not contained in the result also do not overflow.

NoWrapKind must be one of OBO::NoUnsignedWrap or OBO::NoSignedWrap.

Examples: typedef <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/overflowingbinaryoperator">OverflowingBinaryOperator</a> OBO; #define MGNR makeGuaranteedNoWrapRegion MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;-128, 127) MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == &#91;0, -1) MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 0, 1), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == Full Set MGNR(Add, &#91;i8 -1, 6), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;INT&#95;MIN+1, INT&#95;MAX-4) MGNR(Sub, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoSignedWrap) == &#91;-127, 128) MGNR(Sub, &#91;i8 1, 2), OBO::NoUnsignedWrap) == &#91;1, 0)

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h">ConstantRange.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp/#l00315">315</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp">ConstantRange.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### makeMaskNotEqualRange() {#acac5641e821739845b8c56fa071f44ca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantRange ConstantRange::makeMaskNotEqualRange (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; Mask, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; C)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Initialize a range containing all values X that satisfy <code>(X &amp; Mask) / != C</code>.

Note that the range returned may contain values where <code>(X &amp; Mask) / == C</code> holds, making it less precise, but still conservative.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h/#l00182">182</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h">ConstantRange.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp">ConstantRange.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### makeSatisfyingICmpRegion() {#a6fbc74ae7d3a1a1423c26b9ce948f34c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantRange ConstantRange::makeSatisfyingICmpRegion (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">CmpInst::Predicate</a> Pred, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a> &amp; Other)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Produce the largest range such that all values in the returned range satisfy the given predicate with all values contained within Other.

Formally, this returns a subset of &#39;intersection over all y in Other . &#123; x : icmp op x y is true &#125;&#39;. If the exact answer is not representable as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantrange">ConstantRange</a>, the return value will be a proper subset of the above.

Example: Pred = ult and Other = i8 &#91;2, 5) returns &#91;0, 2)

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h/#l00114">114</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constantrange-h">ConstantRange.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp/#l00148">148</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constantrange-cpp">ConstantRange.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
